Key Match Events: Roston Chase scored an unbeaten 42 off 27 balls to secure the win for West Indies.
Andre Russell hit a crucial six to reduce the target to 31 from 18 balls.
Sese Bau scored a half-century (50 off 43 balls) for Papua New Guinea.
Alei Nao took a wicket with his first ball on World Cup debut, dismissing Johnson Charles for a golden duck.
Nicholas Pooran hit 6-4-6 off Bau's offspin at the start of the sixth over.
Rovman Powell struck a boundary but was dismissed in the same over after a review.
PNG's Kiplin Doriga scored 27 off 18 balls, helping PNG add 38 runs from the last 21 balls.
Pre-Game Insights: West Indies, co-hosts of the T20 World Cup 2024, aimed for a confident start but faced a spirited PNG team.
West Indies captain Rovman Powell chose to bowl first due to inclement weather and a fresh wicket.
Post-Match Reflections: Phil Simmons, former West Indies World Cup-winning coach, was a consultant for PNG.
West Indies avoided adding to a list of upsets in a format they once dominated.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Rain interrupted play, leading to a 20-minute delay.
PNG opted not to review an appeal against Nicholas Pooran, which would have been overturned by ball-tracking.
West Indies' recent struggles in ICC competitions were highlighted, including their dismal T20 World Cup defense in 2021 and failure to qualify for the 50-over World Cup in 2023.
